intro: Silene otites subsp. baldaccii, commonly known as the Baldaccii bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has a compact growth habit and produces capsules that contain its seeds. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in full sun. Botanically, it is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms.
